newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria M1 up 0.13 pct, M2 down 18.95 pct in week.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria M1 up 0.13 pct, M2 down 18.95 pct in week.

text.p: Bulgarian M1 money supply inched up to 382.5 billion levs on February 28 from 382 billion levs on February 21 and M2 fell to 3,198 billion levs from 3,945.9 billion levs, preliminary central bank figures showed.
Total broad money decreased 19.41 percent to 3,444.6 billion levs in the week to February 28.
Lev-denominated broad money inched up 0.75 percent to 841.1 billion levs while dollar-denominated broad money fell 24.30 percent to 2,603.5 billion levs.
Hard currency-denominated deposits of companies totalled $695.8 million on February 28, down from $747.4 million a week earlier.
But foreign currency-denominated deposits of individuals rose by $1.8 million to $461.2 million in the week to February 28, figures showed.
Lev-denominated deposits of individuals edged up to 76.6 billion levs on February 28 from 75.6 billion levs a week earlier. @
The lev rose to 2,045.5 to the dollar on February 28 in the central bank fixing used in the calculations from 2,594.8 on February 21. -- Anastas Petrov, Sofia Newsroom, (++359-2) 981 8569
